div.sent: Compared with many countries of the world, the area of our country is very small.
A large population lives in a small country.
These two countries are about the same size.
But the population of Nepal is a little over two crores.
In no country of the world so many people live in so small an area.
But the area has remained the same as before.
By the density of population we mean the number of people living per square kilometre.
If the population increases, the density of population also increases.
In our country the density of population per square kilometre was 624.
The population of Bangladesh is increasing every day.
Because of the increase in population, various problems are cropping up.
The root of all these problems is the increase in population.
People have certain basic needs.
These are food, clothes, housing, health and education.
People cannot live without them.
We will learn about them in the table below.
Food With increase of the size of the family, more food is required.
Our parents often find it difficult to manage food for our needs.
As a result, we suffer from malnutrition and are attacked with diseases.
2.Clothes Many parents cannot afford to buy necessary clothes.
The children have to wear torn clothes.
This does not happen in a small family.
Housing Most families in the country suffer from poverty.
For this reason they cannot afford to build dwelling places.
They cannot even repair the old ones.
Many dwelling places are unhealthy.
All the members of the family have to live in the same house.
Health Most people of the country do not get the opportunity of medical treatment.
They suffer from various diseases.
Many of them die prematurely for lack of treatment.
Education Many children do not get the opportunity of pursuing their education.
In a big family parents cannot maintain it.
For this reason, minor children have to work to earn money.
As a result, roads become dirty.
These people respond to the call of nature and throw garbage everywhere.
Slum problem : Owing to poverty people come to towns for j jobs.
As a result, slums grow in various parts of towns.
These slums are dirty and unclean.
Many anti-social activities take place in the slums.
Unplanned housing : With the increase in population people build dwelling place everywhere.
In these dwelling places there is no sewerage system.
This results in polluted environment.
Public health suffers.
Transport problem : Increase in population leads to increase in traffic.
The smoke from motor vehicles pollutes the environment.
Besides, the vehicles carry extra passengers.
This causes accidents.
This makes movement along the streets risky.
For this reason traffic rules should be obeyed.
We will move about carefully.
Traffic stops when red lights come on.
We will then cross the road using the zebra crossing.
We will always use pavements or sides of the road.
If necessary, we will take the help of the traffic policeman.
As a result theft, robbery, mugging, murders, etc. go up.
The law and order situation iris worse.
With the increase in population, various types of problems are If being created.
The development of the country is being hampered.
To solve these problems, it is necessary to keep the population down.
We will be conscious about it.
